summary.para: An interface that can be used in a class to use different persistent data storage methods.
This interface was developed as a way to test a web class that reads and writes cookies. It allows you to substitute a mock class for the reading and writing.

member.summary: Reads the cookie value with the specified name/key.

member.returns: The value that corresponds to the the specified key. Otherwise NULL is returned.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.ICookieDatasource.WriteValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Persists a key/value pair.
member.remarks: Since no expiration is required, the cookie will be set to expire as far in the future as possible (DateTime.MaxValue).
member.param: The key to use for the cookie value to write.
The value to persist.

member.name: T:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator
member.summary: A panel that is able to rotate server content randomly.
member.example:
<%@ Register Assembly="YTech.General" Namespace="YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation" TagPrefix="CR" %>
<CR:ServerContentRotator runat="server" Key="Rotator1"> <CR:ContentPanel runat="server" Impressions="50" Key="Content1"> Content 1 </CR:ContentPanel> <CR:ContentPanel runat="server" Impressions="50" Key="Content2"> Content 2 </CR:ContentPanel> </CR:ServerContentRotator>

member.name: F:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.SAVED_CONTENT_KEY_COOKIE_POSTFIX
member.summary: The postfix that is attached to the key of the content rotator that is used as the cookie name to load the key of the content that was last displayed.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the control.

member.summary: The method called when the page is loading.

member.summary: Renders the chile controls to the writer.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.choosePanel
member.summary: Determines which panel should be displayed, and displays it.
member.remarks: This method is primarily a wrapper for the choosePanel method. It simply totals the number of impressions for all panels, and then calls that method.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.choosePanel(System.Collections.Generic.List{YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ContentPanel},System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines which panel should be displayed, and displays it.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.GetCookieName
member.summary: Gets the name of the cookie that this content rotator will use to store the display content key.
member.returns: The name of the cookie. Note that the cookie may NOT exist.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.getCookieName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the name of the cookie that stores the content key for the rotator whose key is specified.
member.param: The key of any content rotator.
member.returns: The name of the cookie. Note that the cookie may NOT exist.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.GetSavedContentKey(System.Web.HttpCookieCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the key for the content that was displayed by the content rotator with the specified rotator key.
member.remarks: Basically, you will use this method if you want to know which content section was displayed to a particular user. For example, you would use this if you were doing A/B testing, and wanted to know which version of the content the current user saw.
member.param: The request cookies for the current request where the content key will attempt to be read from.
The key of the content rotator to get the displayed content key for.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.GetSavedContentKeys(System.Web.HttpCookieCollection)
member.summary: Gets all of the rotator key/content key combinations stored in the specified cookie collection.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.GetSavedContentKey(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the key for the content that was displayed by the content rotator with the specified rotator key.
member.remarks: Basically, you will use this method if you want to know which content section was displayed to a particular user. For example, you would use this if you were doing A/B testing, and wanted to know which version of the content the current user saw.
member.param: The key of the content rotator to get the displayed content key for.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.saveContentKey(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the specified key to a cookie so that it can be retrieved for this user later.
member.param: The unique key of a particular content section. This would be the key of the currently displayed content.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.panelChosen(YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ContentPanel)
member.summary: Looks though the panels for one that has the specified key and displays that panel.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.panelChosen(System.Collections.Generic.List{YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ContentPanel},System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Looks though a panel collection for one that has the specified key and displays that panel.
member.param: The panel collection to look for a panel witht the specified content key.
The key to look for in the panel collection.
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the panel was found and selected to be displayed. This could be false if an invalid or old contentKey was supplied.

member.name: M:YTech.General.Web.Controls.ContentRotation.ServerContentRotator.getRandomValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a random number lower than the one specified.
member.remarks: This method is fairly pointless now, because .NET 2.0 has a method that makes it easy to get a number within a specified range.

member.returns: A random number between 0 and totalImpressions

member.name: T:YTech.General.Web.PayPal.PaymentStatuses
member.summary: Summary description for PaymentStatusesEnum.

member.name: F:YTech.General.Web.PayPal.PaymentStatuses.Completed
member.summary: If referring to an initial purchase, this means the payment has been completed and the funds have successfully been added to your account balance.

member.name: F:YTech.General.Web.PayPal.PaymentStatuses.CanceledReversal
member.summary: This means a reversal has been canceled; for example, you, the merchant, won a dispute with the customer and the funds for the transaction that was reversed have been returned to you.

member.name: F:YTech.General.Web.PayPal.PaymentStatuses.Denied
member.summary: You, the merchant, denied the payment. This will only happen if the payment was previously pending due to one of the following pending reasons.

member.name: F:YTech.General.Web.PayPal.PaymentStatuses.Failed
member.summary: The payment has failed. This will only happen if the payment was attempted from your customers bank account.

member.name: F:YTech.General.Web.PayPal.PaymentStatuses.Pending
member.summary: The payment is pending; see the pending_reason variable for more information. Please note, you will receive another Instant Payment Notification when the status of the payment changes to "Completed," "Failed," or "Denied."

member.name: F:YTech.General.Web.PayPal.PaymentStatuses.Refunded
member.summary: You, the merchant, refunded the payment.

member.name: F:YTech.General.Web.PayPal.PaymentStatuses.Reversed
member.summary: This means that a payment was reversed due to a chargeback or other type of reversal. The funds have been debited from your account balance and returned to the customer. The reason for the reversal is given by the reason_code variable.
